intro: Jacquemontia azurea var. alba, commonly known as the white bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white to pale blue in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
